data.author: htan@insider.com (Huileng Tan)
data.title: Gold tops $5,000 in a warning for government bonds
data.description: Government bond markets in high-debt countries are under pressure as investors fear heavy borrowing will erode the value of money.
data.content:
Gold has smashed past $5,000 per ounce mere months after topping $4,000 in a record-setting rally that analysts say reflects growing fears over high government debt.
